lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

@rem See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
@rem Set local scope for the variables with windows NT shell
@rem Resolve any "." and ".." in APP_HOME to make it shorter.
@rem Add default JVM options here. You can also use JAVA_OPTS and GRADLE_OPTS to pass JVM options to this script.
echo ERROR: JAVA_HOME is not set and no 'java' command could be found in your PATH.
echo Please set the JAVA_HOME variable in your environment to match the
echo location of your Java installation.
echo ERROR: JAVA_HOME is set to an invalid directory: %JAVA_HOME%
echo Please set the JAVA_HOME variable in your environment to match the
echo location of your Java installation.
@rem End local scope for the variables with windows NT shell
rem Set variable GRADLE_EXIT_CONSOLE if you need the _script_ return code instead of
* A Duke object which load the SoCCat,  a Personal Assistant Chatbot that helps a person to keep track of various
* things. The task list will be saved whenever there are changes, and will be loaded the next time the bot starts up.
private final static DateTimeFormatter DATE_TIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm");
private void mark(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void unmark(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void createToDos(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void createDeadlines(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void createEvents(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void deleteTask(String[] input) throws DukeException {
private void findTask(String[] input) throws DukeException {
* Parses a given input into 2 parts, mainly the keyword and the task description.
* @param input The full input from the user
* @return The given input split into keyword at index 0 and the task at index 1
* Retrieves the keyword given the user input.
* @param input The full input from the user
* Returns the number that is after the keyword in the user input.
* @param words The task description that is retrieve from the user input
* @return The index of the task that is required
* A Storage object that deals with loading and saving tasks. Whenever the task list updates, {@code saveToDisk} will be
* executed and the new task will be saved into disk. Whenever the bot starts, {@code loadFromDisk} will be executed
* and load all the tasks that were previously saved into the Chatbot.
private final static DateTimeFormatter DATE_TIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm");
* Retrieves the list of tasks that are saved in the disk.
* @return An ArrayList of type Task that consists of all the given tasks that were previously saved.
* @throws DukeException if an I/O error occurs when locating or creating the file with the given pathname.
System.out.println("SoCCat cannot recognise the type of this task: " + keyword);
* Saves the given list of tasks into the disk.
* @param tasks An ArrayList of type Task that consists of all the given tasks that were previously saved.
* @throws DukeException if an I/O error occurs when locating or creating the file with the given pathname.
protected void saveToDisk(ArrayList<Task> tasks) throws DukeException {
* A TaskList object that keeps track of all the tasks on hand.
* @return An ArrayList of type Task that consists of all the current tasks.
* Returns the number of tasks currently in the task list.
* Retrieves the task in the task list that corresponds to the given index.
* @param taskIndex the specified index of the task in the task list
* @return the specified Task corresponding to the given number
* Adds the given task into the task list.
* @param task the specified task to be added into the task list.
* Deletes the task in the task list that corresponds to the given index.
* @param taskIndex the specified index of the task in the task list
* @return the task that is to be deleted
* A Ui object that deals with interaction with the user.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
out.println("Hello! I'm SoCCat\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Displays a farewell message to the user.
out.println("Bye. SoCCat wishes to see you again soon!");
* Displays all the current tasks in the task list to the user.
* @param tasks all the current tasks in the task list
out.println("Here are the tasks in your list: ");
out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Returns a string that states how many tasks are in the task list currently.
* @param size the total number of tasks in the task list
* @return a string that indicates how many task(s) are in the list
return "Now you have " + size + (size < 2 ? " task" : " tasks") + " in your list.";
* @param task the task that is marked
out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + task);
* @param task the task that is unmarked
out.println("Ok! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + task);
* Displays the task that was added into the task list.
* @param task the task that was added
* @param size the total number of tasks in the task list
protected void printTaskAdded(Task task, int size) {
out.println("Got it. I've added this task: \n" + task + "\n" + printNumberOfTasks(size));
* Displays the task that was deleted from the task list.
* @param task the task that was deleted
* @param size the total number of tasks in the task list
protected void printTaskDeleted(Task task, int size) {
out.println("Noted. I've removed this task: \n" + task + "\n" + printNumberOfTasks(size));
super("Please input a date in the following format: dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm");
super(String.format("☹ OOPS!!! The description of a %s cannot be empty.", task));
super(String.format("Please choose a number from 1 to %d", size));
super("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* A Deadline object that is a type of Task, but contains the date and time on top of the task description.
* Returns the LocalDateTime of this Deadline instance.
* @return the datetime information of this {@code Deadline}
* A Event object that is a type of Task, but contains the date and time on top of the task description.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param duration the datetime of the event
* Returns the LocalDateTime of this Event instance.
* @return the datetime information of this {@code Event}
* A Task object that the user inputs into the Chatbot. The Task contains a description of it and could be either
* {@code markAsDone()} to indicate it is completed or {@code unmarkAsNotDone()} to indicate it is not completed.
protected final static DateTimeFormatter DATE_TIME_FORMATTER = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy hh:mm a");
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns {@code true} if the task instance is done, otherwise {@code false}.
* @return {@code true} if the task is completed, otherwise {@code false}.
* Returns a string representation on the completion status of the task, "X" for done, otherwise an empty string.
* @return a string representation on whether the task is done
* Returns a string representation of the description of the given task object.
* @return a string representation of the task description
* Returns a string that states the given task is marked as done.
* @return a string that indicates the given task is marked as done.
return "Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n" + this;
* Returns a string that states the given task is unmarked and not done.
* @return a string that indicates the given task is unmarked and not done.
return "Ok! I've marked this task as not done yet: \n" + this;
* Returns a non-empty string representation of the given task instance.
* @return the string representation of the task with its status
private final ByteArrayOutputStream outputStream = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
assertEquals("Now you have 0 task in your list.", output);
assertEquals("Here are the tasks in your list: \r\n", outputStream.toString());
